text: Presidential elections were held in Gran Colombia in 1825, with Congress certifying the results the following year.Elections and Events 1810-1849 The Library, UC San Diego The result was a victory for Simón Bolívar, who received 582 of the 608 votes.Colombia: Elecciones Presidenciales de 1826 a 1990 Political Database of the Americas Francisco de Paula Santander was elected Vice President. ==Electoral system== The 1821 constitution provided for a system where Provincial Assemblies elected the President and Vice President. If no candidate received a majority of the vote, an election would be held in the Congress. ==Results== ===President=== {| class=wikitable style=text- align:right !Candidate !Votes !% |- |align=left|Simón Bolívar||582||95.72 |- |align=left|José Antonio Páez||11||1.81 |- |align=left|Francisco de Paula Santander||10||1.64 |- |align=left|Antonio José Sucre||4||0.66 |- |align=left|Rafael Urdaneta||1||0.16 |- |align=left|Total||608||100 |- |align=left colspan=3|Source: Historia electoral colombianaHistoria electoral colombiana, La Registraduría, 1991, pp97–98 |} ===Vice President=== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Candidate !Votes !% !Congress vote |- |align=left|Francisco de Paula Santander||285||46.57||70 |- |align=left|Pedro Briceño||79||12.91||6 |- |align=left|José María Castillo||56||9.15||22 |- |align=left|Luis A Baralt||50||8.17||rowspan=15| |- |align=left|Antonio Jose Sucre||39||6.37 |- |align=left|Cristóbal Mendoza||26||4.25 |- |align=left|Domingo Caicedo||25||4.08 |- |align=left|Carlos Soublette||19||3.10 |- |align=left|Francisco Carabaño||7||1.14 |- |align=left|Joaquín Mosquera||6||0.98 |- |align=left|Pedro Gual Escandón||5||0.82 |- |align=left|Mariano Montilla||4||0.65 |- |align=left|José Antonio Páez||4||0.65 |- |align=left|Vicente Aguirre||2||0.33 |- |align=left|Rafael Urdaneta||2||0.33 |- |align=left|Pedro Fortoul||1||0.16 |- |align=left|Miguel Guerrero||1||0.16 |- |align=left|Santiago Mariño||1||0.16 |- |align=left|Total||612||100||98 |- |align=left colspan=4|Source: Historia electoral colombiana |} ==References== Category:1825 elections in South America 1825 Category:1825 in Gran Colombia
title: 1825 Colombian presidential election
